intro: Matthiola songarica, commonly known as the Songarica stock, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Matthiola songarica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
